name: simple pen
description: Barren pen with densities and equipment designed to meet only economic and efficiency goals

name: enhanced pen
description: Pen with more space per animal, flooring substrate designed for enhanced welfare and enrichment attributes appropriate for speciess behavioral need

name: free-range pen
description: Pens including both a low density indoor environment and an outdoor environment with attributes appropriate to meet the species behavioral needs

name: gestation crate
description: Each pregnant sow is kept in a isolated metal enclosure where they are unable to even turn around

name: gestation pen
description: Each pregnant sow has access to a secluded feeding stall and a common area

name: gestation crate enhanced
description: Each pregnant sow has access to a secluded feeding stall and to a common area with appropriate bedding and manipulable material to meet their behavioral needs

name: farrowing crate
description: The lactating sow is kept in an isolated metal enclosure where they are unable to even turn around

name: farrowing pen
description: Pen where the pregnant sow can build a nest and lactating mothers can move and interact with their offspring

name: farrowing hut
description: Huts in (usually) an outdoor area, where pregnant sows can build a nest and together with their offspring can roam outside the hut

name: truck
description: Trucks and trailers that transport pigs to other facilities. It involves the process of loading and unloading animals

name: heating lamp
description: chain

name: toys
description: Balls and items to manipulate are used transiently by pigs; they should be replaced often to be effective (https://www.depts.ttu.edu/animalwelfare/research/environmentalenrichment.php)

name: gilt
description: younger females usually destined to become mothers (http://chaparral4h.weebly.com/swine-terms.html)

name: animals per house
description: number of animals actually in the house (building)

name: animals per enclosure
description: number of animals within each enclosure

name: animal density
description: number of individuals per unit of area

name: space allowance
description: area available for each individual

name: body weight uniformity
description: uniformity of body weights within a flock or group, often measured as percent of weights within 10% of group average

name: dynamic group
description: social group where the composition of the members - and stability of hierarhical relations - is not fixed

name: nest training
description: training of hens to lay eggs in the nests

name: beak trimming
description: removal of parts of the upper and lower beak by cutting through living tissue, blood vessels, bone, skin and horny tissue. Salivary glands may also be touched.

name: dubbing
description: cutting of single combs (growth or crest on the top of the head) to identify sexing errors and avoid issues (e.g. impaired vision) due to their excessive growth

name: toe clipping
description: clipping of the toes (often the hind toe, but also inner toes in some cases), to prevent injury during mating

name: de-spurring
description: pushing of the spurs against a hot spot to stop growth of the spurs

name: feed production
description: type and method of feed production

name: feed delivery
description: methods, frequency, and systems employed for the delivery of feed to the animals

name: feed form
description: form whereby feed is presented to the animals

name: feed nutritional composition
description: to be added

name: feed ingredient composition
description: to be added

name: feed energy composition
description: to be added

name: feed intake
description: intake per period of time

name: roughage supplements
description: fibrous indigestible material in vegetable foodstuffs which aids the passage of food and waste products through the gut

name: mineral supplements
description: provisioning of additional sources of minerals

name: exogenous enzymes
description: functional protein added to feed to improve digestion and feed utilization

name: supply of grit
description: material consisting mainly of crushed stone or shells to help chickens grind the food in the gizzard

name: supply of grain in litter
description: provisioning of dry grains in the litter area

name: water delivery
description: methods and systems employed for the delivery of feed to the animals

name: water
description: drinking water

name: house structure
description: structural components of the facility: vertical levels (tiers/rows), partitioning into pens, presence of fences and other elements separating animals into groups

name: house dimensions
description: size of the housing system in terms of lenght, width, height, area

name: house capacity
description: number of animals the house can hold

name: access to floor
description: access to floor area

name: aisle
description: passage between two rows of cages or two rows of tiers

name: access to outdoor area
description: presence and type of access to areas (verandas, soil, pasture) that enable exposure to natural light and weather conditions

name: solid floor
description: solid sufaces, made of concrete or other materials

name: perforated or slatted floor
description: floors with holes or slats

name: wire mesh floor
description: floor made of a mesh of wire, commonly galvanized steel wire, with hexagonal or rectangular gaps

name: litter area
description: area covered with any friable material enabling the hens to satisfy their ethological needs.

name: conventional cage
description: small enclosures with wire mesh, sloping floors, furnishing only for feeding, drinking, egg collection, manure removal and the insertion and removal of hens

name: furnished cage
description: furnished (or enriched) cages are similar to conventional cages, but with additional furnishings that may include perches, nest boxes, a litter area and extra height

name: rearing cage
description: enclosures where chicks/pullets are raised, before being transferred to the laying facility, at around 17-20 weeks of age

name: single-tier aviary
description: Indoor cage-free housing system developed on a single floor  above the littered floor, without access to outdoor areas.

name: multi-tier aviary
description: Indoor cage-free housing system where the birds have access to vertical levels, or tiers.

name: pens
description: An area (often delimited by a fence or partitions) where animals are kept

name: enclosure gates
description: side of the cage through which it is closed and opened

name: nest
description: separate structure or area designed for hens to lay eggs

name: perches within enclosures
description: an object, within the enclosure, on which the bird settles or roosts, typically an horizontal bar. Perches are often at least 1.3 cm above the floor

name: perches outside enclosures
description: an object, outside the enclosure, on which the bird settles or roosts, typically an horizontal bar

name: nipple drinkers
description: small drinking devices screwed into a water holder that, when pecked at, release a few drops of water. They often have a cup to prevent water from falling on the ground. A reducer of the water pressure on the nipple is often installed to prevent leaks.

name: cup drinkers
description: small drinking devices screwed into a water holder that, when pecked at, release a few drops of water. They often have a cup to prevent water from falling on the ground. A reducer of the water pressure on the nipple is often installed to prevent leaks.

name: bell drinkers
description: small drinking devices screwed into a water holder that, when pecked at, release a few drops of water. They often have a cup to prevent water from falling on the ground. A reducer of the water pressure on the nipple is often installed to prevent leaks.

name: fountain or flow drinkers
description: drinking devices, often of polyethylene, that distributes the water around a plate or shallow structure. Often connected directly to the water supply

name: linear feeders
description: long feeders where animals can feed from one (as is the case for caged hens) or either sides. Feeders can contain elements to prevent food spillage and, when in open areas, to prevent feed from being contamined by droppings

name: circular feeders
description: circular feeders where animals are distributed around the feeder, not used in caged systems

name: ramps
description: sloping surface usually provided to aid hens to reach higher tiers of aviaries

name: dustbathing area
description: area where birds can cower close to the ground, while taking a dust bath, vigorously wriggling their bodies and flapping their wings. This disperses loose substrate into the air. The birds spread one or both wings which allows the falling substrate to fall between the feathers and reach the skin. The dust bath is often followed by thorough shaking to further ruffle the feathers which may be accompanied with preening using the beak (Wikipedia)

name: scratch pads
description: small mat or piece of plastic fixed to the floor to provide the hens with the opportunity to scratch it for food (a behavioral need of hens)

name: pecking objects
description: objects placed in the housing system for birds to peck

name: manipulable material
description: enrichment material (other than bedding material) that may or may not be edible, and is provided to enable the expression of certain behaviors (nesting, foraging)

name: nail or claw shorteners
description: Abrasive materials provisioned to shorten and blunt nails and claws

name: hanging objects
description: Edible and non-edible objects provided in non-cage systems as enrichment

name: photoperiod
description: hours of light every 24 hours

name: lighting program
description: characteristics of the lighting schedule

name: natural light
description: exposure to sunlight

name: accoustic environment
description: characteristics of sounds that can be heard by hens

name: red mite infestation
description: Infestation by Dermanyssus gallinae, a blood-feeding ectoparasite that lives in small cracks inside poultry houses

name: ammonia
description: Noxious gas (NH3) that forms during breakdown of nitrogenous wastes in animal excrement. Ammonia is formed at very high levels in closed facilities and has adverse effects on the eyes and respiratory tract.

name: carbon monoxide
description: carbon monoxide (CO) is a colorless and odorless gas. It  binds to blood hemoglobin, reducing the oxygen bearing capacity of the blood, resulting in headaches, vision disorders, dizziness and ultimately death.

name: carbon dioxide
description: carbon dioxide (CO2) is released through the respiration of animals and biological activities in manure

name: sulphur dioxide
description: sulpher dioxide (SO2) is formed through burning of manure and the greatest allowable concentration is 5 ppm. Concentrations over 5 ppm may have toxic impacts on living organisms

name: hydrogen sulphide
description: hydrogen sulphide is the most dangerous of manure gases, affecting the respiratory tract, digestive tract and nervous system. It can be fatal at high concentrations.

name: particulate matter
description: all solid and liquid particles suspended in air, including both organic and inorganic particles.

name: respirable dust
description: small particles that may be pulled deep into the respiratory tract.

name: inhalable dust
description: particles that which enter the nose and throat during normal breathing and may be found in upper airways.

name: airborne bacteria
description: bacteria present in the atmosphere

name: airborne fungi
description: fungi present in the atmosphere

name: endotoxins
description: components of organic dust with proinflammatory properties, derived from the outer membrane of Gram negative bacteria

name: house temperature
description: temperature inside the hen house

name: house relative humidity
description: percentage of moisture saturation in the air

name: house ventilation
description: provisioning, movement and speed of fresh air inside the hen house

name: house insulation
description: process and materials used to prevent heat loss or heat gain between the inside and outside areas

name: house nebulization
description: vapor pressure systems to cool, humidify, suppress dust and odours

name: house supplemental cooling
description: supplemental systems to keep temperatures from rising inside the building

name: house supplemental heating
description: supplemental systems to keep temperatures from dropping inside the building

name: outdoor relative humidity
description: the amount of water vapour in the air in the vicinities of the house

name: outdoor temperature
description: temp in the vicinities of the house

name: outdoor (range) area
description: open area, with natural light (covered or not)

name: feed withdraw
description: removal of access to food

name: water withdraw
description: removal of access to water

name: analgesic drugs
description: administration of drugs with analgesic effects

name: immunization
description: administration of immunization (e.g. vaccines)

name: antimicrobials
description: administration of antimicrobials

name: forced molting
description: molt is a part of the hen's reproductive cycle when she stops laying and loses her body feathers. This process can be provoked by withdrawing food for 7-14 days and sometimes water for an extended period

name: non-fast molting
description: molt is a part of the hen's reproductive cycle when she stops laying and loses her body feathers. Weight loss occurs.

name: all-in all-out system
description: production strategy where all animals are moved into and out of facilitites at once

name: manure drying
description: forced drying of manure (organic matter derived from animal feces) is used as a means for control of ammonia emissions inside housing systems

name: manure removal
description: removal of manure (organic matter derived from animal feces) from housing system

name: feed cleaning
description: process of removal of all feed content, most frequently from feeders

name: egg collection
description: process used to collect eggs from layers

name: egg belt
description: a belt extending in a given direction for transporting eggs in the conveying direction

name: experience
description: level of experience and know-how to manage the system

name: stockmen
description: stockmen

name: human socialization
description: process of familiarization of the birds with stock personnel, often conducted to minimize fearful reactions

name: internal inspections
description: internal inspections by stock personnel to verify functioning of equipment, presence of eggs outside the nest area, presence of dead animals and any possible anomalies

name: independent inspections
description: inspection of facility by indepedent auditors

name: certification
description: certification, by independent institution, that specific animal welfare and health standards are met

name: video monitoring
description: presence of closed-circuit television (CCTV) equipment or any other video monitoring system

name: sexing
description: isto precisa ser definido melhor
